section.title: Present/Future modals of possibility
section.sectiontitle: Use could, may or might to talk about present or future possibility.
section.text1a: I'm not sure but she might be in the garden.
section.text2: Do you think there'll be an election soon?
section.text2a: Possibly. There could be one next September.
section.sectiontitle2: Use can to talk about more general or theoretical possibility.
section.text3a: The weather can be quite bad this time of year.
section.text4a: You can often find bargains in the shops around here.

section.title: Present/Future modals of possibility
section.sectiontitle: Use must to say that you believe something is certain.
section.text1a: You haven't had anything to eat all day. You must be starving.
section.text2a: He's wearing a scarf. He must be cold.
section.sectiontitle2: Use can't to say that you believe something is not possible.
section.text3a: They can't know many people. They've only just moved here.
section.text4a: She can't be his mother. She's much too young.
